intro: Apostasia selebica, commonly known as the Celebes ginger, is a rare and ornamental plant native to Indonesia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes over 20,000 species of flowering plants. The plant features rhizomatous growth and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and green. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
